website_summaries.verdict: The ultraslim design and laundry list of features can't overcome the buggy software. Once Garmin fixes these problems, the Vivoactive could be a good product, but until then, there are better options available.
pros: The Vivoactive has an ultraslim design, good battery life and an always-on color display that shines in outdoor performance
It has vibration and notification alerts from your smartphone, activity tracking with auto-adjusting goals, multisport tracking through GPS, and can be worn in the shower and the pool
cons: The Connect IQ app store is lacking, Garmin's mobile app is dated and sleep tracking is unimpressive
The watch software and smartphone connectivity can also be unstable, requiring frequent reboots

customer_reviews.title: Sadly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch at first. I bought it last December and in April it stopped working during a swimming workout. It shut down for 3 days even after being charged. It works a random times at best and turns off completely in the water. The sad part is I bought a 3 year warranty on the watch, I have emailed Garmin and the warranty people and no one will email me back. No one seems to want to help with this defective watch when all I would like is a replacement. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Schieltz

customer_reviews.title: Buttons are terrible, autopause useless for MTB.
customer_reviews.text: You can't wear it on your right hand, especially when biking, because of the buttons. You can't put it in your bag, either. Also, the auto-pause pauses INSTANTLY and takes forever to resume. It'll stop when your riding up short technical sections on a mountain bike, and it won't resume until at least a fifty yards later. It drives me nuts. You can customize this or just manually pause, but it's a pain in the ass and never works right. Two stars because it works decently for road biking. Also, the max battery life with everything like Bluetooth disabled is only 5 hours, not 10 as advertised, you it won't work for all day rides.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Bummed that it broke (due to swimming), but GREAT for running. Not a good warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Garmin prior to swimming with it one day. The design was not waterproof and now it doesn't work. Used for running, too. Great for running. Tracked my mileage while training for a half. Also, great for knowing how many steps you take per day. Great at sleep tracking. I really, really loved this watch before it broke. Also, bummed about Garmin's customer service. I called and was told that they could do nothing. Sometimes it happens. Sad. Wish there was a better warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This watch is an ok all-around fitness tracking device. ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch is an ok all-around fitness tracking device. I have none of the other complaints other users report i.e., battery life or screen dimness. Basically I wanted a watch that would work indoors for my treadmill runs without the need to connnect a foot pod. At this task, the vivoactive fails miserably. I have run about 15 runs outdoors to allow it to self-calibrate as the user manual instructed, sadly this is still absurdly inaccurate. I ran 3 miles last night on the treadmill and the watch had me at 1.8 miles. I've run for 20 years and so I know my pace wasn't off by this much.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Love the configurability of this device
customer_reviews.text: Garmin is killing FitBit for sure. Love the configurability of this device, and ability to download third-party faces. Definitely keeps me motivated for my daily activities, runs, and all other action. The display may seem dim while indoors, but you get used to it quickly. The outdoors is what I need this for, especially while running. I can check the overall pace, along with current pace, allowing me to adjust accordingly during half-marathons.
customer_reviews.author: Sanju Naik

customer_reviews.title: Mom tested
customer_reviews.text: Have had this watch for 18 months, still absolutely love it. Pros : so durable! Survives my crazy children which 3 fit bits could not do Battery life is incredible! 2 weeks in between charges, less time if you accidentally forget to stop the GPS for your run, though Charges super fast, too! I have used it to track swimming, walking, running and treadmill running. Also, frequently use it to find my phone. I am not a big tech person, but have found the app user friendly for my purposes. Cons: screen is a little big for my wrist -does not bother me but if there were a daintier version I'd buy it
customer_reviews.author: Shari Samms

customer_reviews.title: Acetate Band may irritate
customer_reviews.text: The watch itself is great, but the acetate band caused a rash on my wrist. I have ordered a nylon band so that I can use the watch when I am working out, swimming and walking. Up until the rash (which happened within 1 week), the watch worked great. I used it for swimming a couple of times, to track steps, and to track workouts. I would have preferred it if the watch had come with a different watch band, but it is still a good watch.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Music controls don't work with Samsung Galaxy S8+
customer_reviews.text: So the fitness portions are great and golf feature is key but I wanted it to control music at the gym and I guess the app hasn't been updated in a while because I have a Samsung Galaxy S8+ and only the volume controls work. The next track, pause/play, or previous track do not work so I am sending it back. Music controls do not work properly with Samsung Galaxy S8+.
customer_reviews.author: MattUSCtrojan

customer_reviews.title: This Garmin model works much better than I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: Very light & comfortable. More accurate than my previous fitbits. None of the step counters are perfect but this one is good enough. Really happy to discover the golf app. Perhaps not so fancy but basically does everything a $2-300 dedicated golf widget does. And you can download all the courses. Size-wise I like this much better than the newer models, plus I don't need bells & whistles. I just want a good quality watch with gps and steps, and the golf app is a bonus. This Garmin model fits the bill. It's also not a large pancake on my wrist so my dress shirts continue to fit nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Koop

customer_reviews.title: Love my Vivoactive Smartwatch at great budget price and does ...
customer_reviews.text: Love my Vivoactive Smartwatch at great budget price and does what devices three times as much cost...2 weeks until a charge is a bonus compared to 18 hours for the Apple device. I get to download as many watch faces as I want and use a different one for everyday...notifications are awesome and timely and runs on GPS just press start and off you go with recent activities saved. Second Garmin device having Garmin Vivofit 2 for two years and could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: GilbertRoots

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrific unit, much cheaper than a Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific unit, much cheaper than a Fitbit, far more versatile, and without the annoying keep-your-spouse-awake LED lights. It keeps wanting to social-media my every step, but you don't have to give in. It tracks steps, reminds me to get my butt up off the chair once in a while, and has a really nice golf GPS which told me the exact distance to the center of the green and didn't laugh at me when I put the ball in the bunker. (It probably wanted to tell everyone on social media, though.) The default display is easily readable, and the battery life is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Another Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good basic GPS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a timekeeper and speedometer for canoe training. So far it has performed those functions well, and has not been affected by the water splashed on it. The touchscreen is not very responsive when my fingers get cold, but this is remedied by blowing on them. I used the bicycling mode for canoeing, since this gives me miles per hour, with time per 5 miles splashed on the screen every 5 miles. It also works in running mode, where the output is minutes per mile. In this mode the average speed is flashed on the screen every mile.
customer_reviews.author: Will Siegfried

customer_reviews.title: The online instructions are useless and it is not one bit intuitive
customer_reviews.text: this is among the most maddening of devices and I deeply regret having faith that I would figure this out...and now it's past the return time. The online instructions are useless and it is not one bit intuitive. If I set it to Run, I can sometimes find the heart rate monitor...but mostly not, or it fails to function if I can even find the screen. Pool laps? It adds laps for unknown reasons and seemingly at random times. So how far did I swim? Hard to tell. Very sorry that I made this purchase and I expect a LOT more from Garmin
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic watch looks good and works great. I use to have the Forerunner which was okay until the strap broke but this watch is so much better. The battery life is good and the charging lead is perfect just slot it on. The watch is light but solid. Best feature is that it picks up your mileage pace in a couple of seconds if you change pace by doing intervals.Highly recommend. Excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Heyward

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Item
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this Garmin model watch for years and have loved it. Ordered one earlier this year for my Husband and several months later it no longer works properly. We have completed the trouble shooting suggestions by Garmin, to no avail. We can only assume that this particular watch was faulty from the beginning. Sorry to write this review as my Garmin watch has been going strong for years.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Malara

customer_reviews.title: Horrible--don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after roughly 7 months with normal use. Neither Amazon or Garmin will service as they claim it's no longer under warranty, even though it was purchased 12/30/2017. Makes absolutely no sense! Spend more and buy Apple, better customer service and legit warranties. *S/N 3PW540767 Denied Warranty Service 8/30/18
customer_reviews.author: RSW

customer_reviews.title: Garmin VivoActive
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today, set up was pretty easy. I have a pretty thin wrist and i think it fits great! I was kind of worried about it being bulky but it really isnt at all, very light too, just feels like a regular watch. Everything seems to be going good so far, i still need to do some activities with it so im sure i'll be updating later in a month or so, overall very happy and would recommend (so far) ;)
customer_reviews.author: ML1980

customer_reviews.title: Extremely reliable Garmin watch that works with 2019 Garmin Connect App.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it does - reliably and repeatedly for years. I use this watch solely for tracking my bike rides and this does a great job! I have a Bontrager Node 1 bike computer and I needed an ANT+ capable GPS watch to log my rides and connect the ANT+ speed, cadence, temp. and HR sensors. This watch does it perfectly. There are newer watches that has more capability but for me this is all I need - so have not upgraded to something new till now.
customer_reviews.author: Md. Tanveer Yasser

customer_reviews.title: Can not swim with watch.
customer_reviews.text: At first the watch and phone would both sync. After several days of unpairing, deleting app, reinstalling and repairing it finally started working and we loved it. However 1st time taking watch into pool to swim and it completely shut down. Water poured out if watch face. Very disappointed as we picked this over fitbit for the swimming feature.
customer_reviews.author: DandG

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep track of your health!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great buy! My son in law needed a watch for work and wanted a tracker for health like walking, etc. So my daughter found this watch on amazon. He loves it! It does have the heart monitor which is fine. The battery life is amazing! He uses it for over 10 hours with alerts and doesn't make much of a dent. The light is dim so you can we the apps just not as bright as he would like. That is the only thing he had to say which is why it is 4 out of 5 stars. Other than that fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.author: SylRod

customer_reviews.title: ode to watch
customer_reviews.text: An aspiring triathlete, an enthusiast too. Had an old garmin, wouldn't charge, needed a new one so i saw this sleek black design blue tooth syncing keeps my data in line. Battery could hold longer but thats here or there, depending on your activity, which is easy to share. marathon was fine but my century ride was not. battery dies quickly when, to save & exit, i forgot.
customer_reviews.author: CatLoversUnite

customer_reviews.title: The best watch I have ever had, seriously it is
customer_reviews.text: The best watch I have ever owned. Does everything I want it to. Sometimes there is a failure for the bluetooth connection but its easily fixed and rarely happens. I love the app that goes with it, it works perfectly fine, despite the reviews. GPS works great, step counter and calorie counter is accurate. It really is waterPROOF as well. I went swimming several times and it worked just fine. Well worth the buy. I recommend getting the screen protector for it as well. Paid all that money for it, why not , right? I love this watch
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: This is a great fitness tracker!
customer_reviews.text: This fit tracker does everything I need it to do. GPS locks on very quickly and I've found it to be very accurate. Battery life is exceptional. In watch mode it will go 3+ weeks between charges. Even in GPS mode the battery will require charging once every week or so. It's easy to read and very customizable. Much, much better than the Fitbit. Only complaint is the standard band wears out (cracks) quickly. I replaced mine with a metal magnetic type from Amazon and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this watch for my half-marathon training, and it's an excellent device! Very comfortable and light weight... the GPS has been very accurate thus far, and doesn't take very long to sync up (between 10 seconds to one minute at most) The fact that you can use it while swimming is a big plus... I haven't really used it yet for other workouts such as biking and swimming, but it seems like this watch would be more than capable. The amount of detail you can view on the GarminConnect app is truly impressive. This watch is fantastic I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: All good so far
customer_reviews.text: Only using it it track distance walked or run at the moment. All good so far. I didn't need an Apple watch and this one is doing just what I needed. Yes, the features on the watch face *are* a bit difficult to read indoors, but not impossible. Just seeing what the time is is fine. And you can temporarily brighten the screen indoors by pressing the power button. However, everything is crystal clear outdoors, and that's the key for this kind of watch!
customer_reviews.author: TMW_Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: The batterie life on this watch is great. It is water proof and thus far very ...
customer_reviews.text: The batterie life on this watch is great. It is water proof and thus far very durable. The foot step tracker seems to be about 30% low on counting steps at least in comparison to Fit Bit and Pebble. I wish there was a way to silence the get up and move function on the watch seeing as though I am on my feet all day and the last thing I want is the darn thing telling me to get back on my feet when I finally get a chance to sit down. I also miss the flick of the wrist back lit screen display that was available on the other 2 watches.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B Newell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Watch
customer_reviews.text: Love it. This is a fantastic sports watch. If you're looking for a GPS enabled sports watch, especially for triathaloners, this is definitely the way to go. Great battery life. Seemingly accurate GPS. Smartphone notifications. Only downside is that it doesn't do open water swimming. But in order to get a GPS watch for open water swimming, you have to get a significantly larger and more expensive sports watch. I wear this thing all day every day, and it's built in step tracker with goals is a nice accountability tool to help stay active.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy it if you swim, says it’s waterproof but it’s not, piece of junk that dies after a couple of months. I’ve been through two of them in a year, thought it was anomaly when the first died but the second one did the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike1958

customer_reviews.title: Great watch while it worked for a short period of time. N = 2
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin Vivoactive GPS fitness tracker was a great watch while it worked. I purchased two of these, one for myself and one for my wife. Both were used about 3-4x a week, and both were non-functional within 18 months. One of the watches refused to boot, the other watch will only hold a charge for 24 hours, without being in GPS mode. Both watches are out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch - a great alternative to the the apple watch and great for swimmer
customer_reviews.text: I love the product - I was unfortunately that the first two garmin watches had a software problem and after calling Garmin they replaced it ASAP, the one I am using now works well for 2 weeks - now and I am counting - but when it works it is great - wonderful - I am a swimmer, runner and ride the bike - I love the summary and the measures - the states and the connection online as well as on the ipad or iphone. Again still a bit nervous if the software will go bad again - but for now it is very very cool
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: The best GPS watch out there!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is the best! I didn't think I would need all the functions on this guy, but I wear it everyday. I love that all my running, biking, walking and swimming data automatically download to my phone so I can transfer it to the lose it app and others. The charge lasts a really long time. It's so nice knowing how far I've traveled outside and the app tells me how many calories I've burned. I will always stick with Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good activity watch, good price
customer_reviews.text: Good activity watch. Like most Garmin products, hardware is really good but user interface could use tweaking. Customizable...added a canoeing tracking option. Sleeping mode works ok, but wearing a watch while sleeping is uncomfortable. Long battery life after charging. Overall, nice watch.
customer_reviews.author: M. Orth

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this watch
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this watch. Charge lasts up to a week depending on your activities. Good price for a watch like this. Golf GPS was a key reason I got it besides being able to track my runs and walks. Super handy having on the golf course. Being able to be alerted with a light vibration from my iphone notifications is awesome. Keeps you from constantly looking at your phone for the smallest little things. The GPS/run/walk tracking is super and being able to track my steps each day right on my wrist is a bonus! Wish there were better watch faces but it appears to be still a work in progress.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Sanguinetti

customer_reviews.title: Get it.  It's good.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. You get tons of features, for relatively little money. I wear it all the time. I've used it swimming, cycling and running and I'm happy all-around with it. I agree with others that sometimes it doesn't quite get the lap count right when swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great watch! Wishing for some slight changes to interface...
customer_reviews.text: Really love this watch although I wish there were alternate indoor modes available other than the ones they offer. (For example weight training mode, cardio class mode, etc. It only allows you to choose from indoor cycling, walking and running.) Also important to note this does NOT work for open water swimming.
customer_reviews.author: C. Froese

customer_reviews.title: Good sports watch
customer_reviews.text: I like it for tracking steps and pool laps. I use another watch for heart rate. The pool lap counter is sometimes off. Shows alerts from my paired phone. This was a replacement for a watch several years old that had the screen crack.
customer_reviews.author: TTOOL

customer_reviews.title: Love the new Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Love the new Garmin. I have owned Garmin for many years. I love the feature that it is a running watch and pedometer in one. Do not have to wear the vivofit2 and my running watch. Connects with my Garmin app quicker than my vivofit2. Would recommend this product to anyone looking for a running watch and pedometer in one. There have been concerns with the lighting of the screen. It is dimmer than what is advertised but do not see this as a disappointment. It does have a button on the left that lights up the screen well in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great watch. Rather pay a little extra money for better quality
customer_reviews.text: The watch was ok. I took it for a run and did a great job showing me my pace. Extremely light. The screen is very dim especially in the dark. The backlight button would not work sometimes and I would have to push the button repeatedly to get it to work. Did a great job of showing me notifications and changing songs on Spotify though it doesn't show you the song on the watch, just the pause next and previous button. Overall it was decent unfortunately had to return.
customer_reviews.author: S. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: I got this watch for my husband to replace his ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch for my husband to replace his old Garmin watch that had stopped charging. It has every feature he was looking for without breaking the bank. He has yet to try the bike or golf feature but really enjoys that it links to his android and shows when he received texts and emails. It also buzzes to remind him to get up and moving when he has been sitting for too long! He rarely takes it off except to shower, however this is just out of habit as it IS water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Kgryan92

customer_reviews.title: Do not use for Swimming
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch until it died 14 months after ordering it. I normally use it for running only because I have had issue with other watches dying while swimming. I decided to quit using my cheap watch to time my laps and use the swim app to track my laps, speed & time because I thought it was sealed better because you don't have to ever replace the battery. Today was the third time that I used it for swimming and it is dead. Update: After I wrote the review I called customer service at Garmin and I got something worked out. Thank you Garmin Customer Service
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Lancour

customer_reviews.title: Great watch...until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: This watch was a beautiful thing of beauty when it worked, but then, after 18 months, the function button stopped, well, functioning, rendering it useless as a training watch. The best Garmin support could do was offer to send us another one - FOR $100!!!! Thanks, but no thanks. Too bad we're outside the return window.
customer_reviews.author: ReadWrite69

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Most functions on the watch only work when connected to an app on your phone. It continued to drop connectivity to my phone (I had an iPhone and then a Google Pixel and both dropped Bluetooth to watch consistently.) After 3 months of owning, it just stopped working. It wouldn't hold a charge. Garmin support wouldn't do anything since it was past the 1 month return policy. I would not buy this again or any other product from Garmin since they don't back their products.
customer_reviews.author: J Dean

customer_reviews.title: great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: love it! I bought this because I needed a GPS and for golf. I do use it to walk. It is really easy to use, just push 2 buttons and you are logging your exercise. It automatically syncs to your phone and to the webpage. I have to recharge it about every 12 days. I had a Apple Watch, but like this more, because had to recharge apple watch every night and didn't have GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Paula S Evershed

customer_reviews.title: Nice long battery life
customer_reviews.text: Nice long battery life. Screen could be brighter. I find it to be accurate in distance for running. Haven't used it biking or swimming yet. I love that it is waterproof and don't have to worry about taking it off when washing dishes or giving kids a bath (I ruined a few fitbits this way).
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey S.

customer_reviews.title: Utilitarian gps
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to track my outside activity via gps, and that's exactly what it does. It's not comfortable, pretty, or quite frankly easy to see without light, but I don't have it on long, am not wearing it out to brunch, and once it's started you don't have to look at the screen again until you are done. It syncs fast, and plays nice with other fitness apps.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie A.

customer_reviews.title: Display is great in very bright daylight but hard to see in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is Ok strictly for use as an excercise watch. The software is awful and getting it up and running the time took hours and hours. The updates were many a d confusing. Display is great in very bright daylight but hard to see in lesser light and impossible to see in dim or dark. It has a backlight though. There is no mic or speaker, I knew before I bought but found that I missed having the mic. I have since bought something better for geenralnuse
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Good for workout not good for bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I have this watch for two years. It is good to keep track of your pace and distance. I wish it could track my heart rate. The bluebooth is not great. You need to open the connect app to connect your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: This watch comes with tech support😃
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. We have Garmin handheld gps and chart plotter, and have been very happy with the Garmin support team. What seems intuitive to a younger person is clear as mud to us older folks, so where tech is concerned support is a must. They did not disappoint! It took several calls, but he’s a happy runner! He’s very satisfied with all the features.
customer_reviews.author: Kate  Smith

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE my new Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE my new Garmin! I had a Fitbit previously and the mileage when I ran wasn't always accurate. The Garmin has been spot on and I love that I can use it track multiple activities because I'm currently training for a triathlon.
customer_reviews.author: Shock

customer_reviews.title: Know what you're buying
customer_reviews.text: If you want a smart watch this is not it. But on the bike, in the pool, or out for a jog this is a phenomenal fitness watch. I use it every day for marathon and triathlon training and it auto-syncs with TrainingPeaks. I've also found the sleep tracking useful. Garmin Connect's UI and mobile app are lacking, but I can deal with it. The pool laps are off by 1-2 lengths sometimes but who cares? This watch effectively replaced 4-5 apps I was using before with one functional, accurate device. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Griffis

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, but has a very cheap look.
customer_reviews.text: This device is very functional and works exactly as stated for it's intended purpose. The big negative for me turned out to be that it looks like a watch. A very cheap watch (kind of reminds me of the calculator watch I had in elementary school.) Because of it's form factor, it doesn't look like a fitness band, which aren't nice aesthetically, but if it's going to look like a watch, you want it to look nice. As others have mentioned, the dimness of the screen means you will always be using the backlight, even in a well lit room. Would definitely look at further iterations, but for now, I decided on returning it and went for the Microsoft Band.
customer_reviews.author: SPH

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately it lost my daily progress many times
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it lost my daily progress about 6-8 times. And because of that I lost my weekly challenge((( And such issue happened second time during last few months. Previously it spoiled my 'Longest Goal Streak' record. On Monday it spoiled my challenge result. Today it lost my progress again. I tried to reinstall garmin software, login/logout from garmin connect, restart my PC but it didn't help. VivoActive randomly lose my data. I don't recommend to buy this device
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: INACCURATE STEPS AND DISTANCE TRACKING
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this for the distance tracking feature, only to find that it is incredibly inaccurate. I teach a course that has measured distance markers for the hikes required to pass and every hike my garmin is off by more than a mile; with or without a full battery. Additionally, not surprising given the aforementioned complaint, the steps are typically off anywhere from 3 to 7 thousand. It’s ridiculous. I bought the watch in February and starting working where I do in April unfortunately passed the return/refund date given. Had I not been working here I likely wouldn’t have realized the inaccuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Roz

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I bought it. Works great running or walking outside. Usually picks up the GPS pretty quickly. Also does a great job counting steps all day long. Good job on treadmill as well. I love the fact that I don't have to worry about it getting rained on, or being in the shower or pool. However, when I am driving my MotorHome, the vibrations coming up the wheel make the watch count steps. So I have to remember to take off my watch before I start driving the RV, then remember to put it back on again. Doesn't do this in my car. Would rate as 5 stars if not for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: CallMeChris

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life and Garmin is the undisputed king of ...
customer_reviews.text: It has served me very well. Great battery life and Garmin is the undisputed king of GPS reliability. The couple times I have bought other brands products I have always regretted it ALWAYS.
customer_reviews.author: Apostle

customer_reviews.title: , I sent it back and Garmin sent me a refurbished one a month later. It didn't work right out of the box. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: While this watch was working it was great! It was everything that I hoped it would be. I used it for 18 walk/bike treks and it stopped working. I have contacted Garmin customer service.When I see how/if they resolve the situation I will report back and hopefully be able to change my review.
customer_reviews.author: Inmyhumbleopinion

customer_reviews.title: This Smart Watch exceeded my expectation by a mile
customer_reviews.text: This Smart Watch exceeded my expectation by a mile. It does everything I wanted it to do, and everything I needed it to do for all my exercise routines, including tracking my sleep patterns. I would highly recommend this watch to any person who exercises regularly or wants to develop a good healthy habit of exercising regularly. It's a little hard to read in low light level, but other then that, it is a fantastic addition to my exercise program. Garmin has hit this one out of the park.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Uno

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. I returned my Asus Zenwatch 2 for this and have no regrets. Great, accurate GPS, keeps great track of my steps, walks, running. The Garmin Connect is GREAT. I'm a very novice runner, maybe 6-8 miles a week, but this little watch motivates me to run further and faster.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its dim, but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.text: I use the Vivoactive and I love it. I don't have it on 24/7 to track steps and sleep but i do use it for my swims, runs, bike rides, gym, etc. i just used it on the treadmill at the gym and it was pretty accurate. A few things i like about it? Its easy to fine tune for your use (ie set size of pool, or set alerts for pace reminders...), and the battery lasts a decent amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: alex lakeman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this product it's very user friendly waterproof connects with the app on my smartphone automatically once you set it up the first time from then on. No batteries to replace just take it off and recharge battery about every 2-3 weeks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Collins

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connectivity needs help
customer_reviews.text: I love the sleep tracking ability. Based on movement during the sleep period. Bluetooth connection is not great. You often have to refresh the connection between the watch and phone. The watch band has to be replaced every now and then. I’ve done it twice since my purchase in Dec. 2017. All around a great watch that’ll get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Step counter function
customer_reviews.text: The watch works perfectly well and the functionality of it works fine, but my only concern is the step counter feature. When I wear it on the daily it tends to count arm movements when I'm not even walking which is pretty irritating to me. For instance, when I go out for movie or to shop, in my head I do figure it to be roughly 400-500 steps, but when I'm through it reads out to be around 1,800+ Let's hope for an update to possibly fix this at least. COME ON!
customer_reviews.author: brett lovaasen

customer_reviews.title: The Athlete's Watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. I've used it for running, biking, swimming, and golf. It is well made, the app and software has been getting better and better. I have it linked with a Scosche Rhythm for heart rate and Garmin tracking is the best! The amount of detail is fantastic, Golf GPS is incredibly accurate and the iPhone notifications are great to have. If you are an athlete you want this watch over any other apple watch or the like.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Battery died after two years
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch and wore it every day for two years. The charge held for a good two weeks at a time until recently. Now I can’t even go a full day before the battery dies. I’m SO Sad! I hoped a $150 watch would last me more than three years. Other than that, it’s the best fitness watch I could have gotten. Love the garmin brand.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Love Garmin. Check out DC Rainmaker if you are deciding what fitness watch to buy.
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research before deciding to pick the vivoactive, and its living up to my expectations. If you're in the market for a smart watch for working out, check out the reviews by DC Rainmaker. His website is amazingly thorough.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: This watch is nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: This watch is nice for the price. It doesn't do everything an apple watch does but it has the basic functions and its great that you can track your activities. The watch face is really large and easy to read. I think it might be a little large for a lot of women on their wrists. Whenever you get an alert it vibrates really loudly which can be annoying if you are in public/ work. Also if periodically becomes unsyned from my phone and the calendar wont snyc again until I reboot it.
customer_reviews.author: jennie

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Watch
customer_reviews.text: This product was not new as described, it did not come in a Garmin box (plain white box). I had a hard time setting up the device because another persons information was on the Garmin. I had to have a tech look into it. He reset the watch back to factory settings and it worked. I sent the seller two emails regarding a used watch. I have had no response. For the price of the watch I would have bought used. No resolution as of today.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth DiPiero

customer_reviews.title: I really like my Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I really like my Garmin. This is my 3rd PGS watch. I had a Schwinn and a Papago. The Schwinn died after a year or so. The case on the Papago broke where in hold the band. I can wear the Garmin all day like a normal watch. I walk to work 2 miles each way and charge it once a week. I don't think it would go 2 weeks without a charge for me. I would buy this watch again.
customer_reviews.author: just me

customer_reviews.title: Good-Looking and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This watch has worked great and I find that the gps is accurate. the indoor running is also pretty accurate as well (compared with another gps at the same time). It is low-profile and has become my everyday watch. My only issue with the watch is the move feature that goes off when you don't move every hour. There is no way to get it to stop bugging you except for taking a walk. I'm at work most of the day, I can't just go for a walk and I don't want it to bother me. Other than that, the watch is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Marinda Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Good watch
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. I’ve used most of the features and with the app they are great. Use the biking and walking feature all the time. Use it like a gps unit and make laps near areas I want to return to when walking woods
customer_reviews.author: Josh Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best workout watch for your $$$
customer_reviews.text: This is great bang for your buck. I am a triathlete and this is perfect for tracking my swims, bikes, and runs. There are a couple things that are lacking though. First, the start stop button is becoming less sensitive so I have to press down harder and sometimes does not work. Second, the calorie tracker is definitely inaccurate. Third, while running around any size track the gps is not accurate. Other than these minute things this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Truett Bloxsom

customer_reviews.title: Waste of good money on poor product
customer_reviews.text: This watch was a real treat for me to purchase... I wanted it for fitness, but primarily for golf GPS.. watch work for 6 months.. I've called customer service and they couple of times, nothing continued to work... This is second time being 'burnt' by company & will never ever, not even on Sunday buy another garmin product or will allow friends too!!
customer_reviews.author: Robb F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect watch for GPS tracking runs and ability to use in water while still having smart watch notifications.
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I would change about this watch is its shape. I can and have gotten over that due to all the functionality it provides me. The notifications are wonderful, as well as the GPS. Takes minimal time to find a satellite and on runs with other people using GPS watched our distances were always within a few meters. Absolutely love that it is water proof, I took it in the ocean without worries so a swimming pool is nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Evan McVeigh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance, versatility, durability, and value.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very versatile, easy to use, durable, and has very good battery life. This is the second one I've owned (I whacked and cracked the screen on the first one after ~ 2 years of use). I use mine to track my weight, bike rides, walks, and lap swims. The sleep tracking is a bonus. I had to replace the original strap on both units, but none of the straps irritated my skin the way the FitBit did. Also, by adjusting the settings, I go two weeks between charges. Finally, I bought my newest unit used. The seller was accurate in the description and very prompt on the delivery. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: T Teeters

customer_reviews.title: To all you haters complaining about the screen...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch a few weeks ago and I am nothing but satisfied. I'm still working out all of the settings to get it "just right", but straight out of the box it has been amazing. I was nervous seeing as there were some complaints and bad reviews regarding the dimly lit screen and I'm wondering if they know about the backlight button on the left side of the watch. That's the only explanation I can think of because I have no problems with it. Is it like the picture online? No. But I seriously have no problems reading it ever, outdoors or inside.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gerling

customer_reviews.title: The vivoactive is terrible all around especially if you're going to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: The vivoactive is terrible all around especially if you're going to use it for golf. The app on my Galaxy S9 works fine but the watch is unreliable and it never explains what is wrong or why a function simply refuses to work. The touch screen is also clunky and slow. It was a complete waste of $ and caused many hours of frustration with no resolutions. I much prefer their old watch that didn't require any synching with a phone. No more Garmin products for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ku

customer_reviews.title: I love my watch and all the extra bells and whistles ...
customer_reviews.text: I love my watch and all the extra bells and whistles it comes with on the Garmain connect website. The screen is a bit difficult to see sometimes, depending on the environmental light. The watch light is adequate and is sufficient. The watch is thinner than other GPS watches i have owned and that is a plus for me. Connect IQ has downloadable watch-faces that are free and
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. The watch and band are a bit big ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The watch and band are a bit big to get used to on a woman's wrist, but it works great, tracks my runs accurately and I'm now obsessed with counting my steps every day. It's a really great tool and I'm looking forward to using it more. So far the battery lasts at least a week and probably would last longer except I want a fully charged battery before my weekly long run. Looking forward to its waterproof feature but haven't tested it yet.
customer_reviews.author: t. joe

customer_reviews.title: It has done everything advertised and I love it! Can't wait for more apps and widgets ...
customer_reviews.text: It has done everything advertised and I love it! Can't wait for more apps and widgets in the Garmin Connect store, and assume that will come as it is used more. Fantastic for running and biking to track pace and distance with very accurate GPS. Swimming works well too. Haven't tried golfing yet, but hope to soon. Notification to help you realize how long you have been sitting are great to get you up and moving throughout the day. You get use to the screen being a bit dim in low light, and as that seems to be the biggest complaint people have with it, I would say we are doing pretty well. Love it and definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rabbach

customer_reviews.title: Great watch. Tough, water resistant, does what it says. No problems with GPS or communications. Good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch, even though it's got some quirks. I've accidentally bumped the go/stop button on the right side while running, stopping the time. But it does a bunch of stuff, keeps time, talks to my phone, and generally is a good sports watch, step counter and smart watch. Batter life is good, like two weeks
customer_reviews.author: Populo Iratus

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my purchases
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my purchases. Sometimes on a cloudy day it does take longer than I'd like to connect to GPS, but still very happy with the watch. I use mostly for long runs and on the golf course. The compatability using my iPhone to download a golf course and transfer to my watch is very straightforward and extremely useful. Great purchase and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Great for all-in-one fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: Great product for an all-in-one type of watch. Only negative is that the screen is dark and hard to see at night (which has been mentioned before). I primarily use the running, golf, and smart watch features. Running and golf gps features are easy to use and a great middle ground from a pure running watch or pure golf watch. The addition of the smart watch features (when connected to phone: weather, alerts for emails, calls, texts, etc., calendar) are all easy to use and helpful. The watch itself is comfortable and very small for a gps watch. Fits smaller and larger wrists well.
customer_reviews.author: Inace

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS PRODUCT. the background light is fine, bright enough. I love how it updates to my phone. the charge is great. I love the swimming function, i can zone out when swimming laps in the pool and it will count laps for me. It is less bulky then my wife's tri watch. I would recommend this product. My old garmin heart rate monitor linked with this watch as well.
customer_reviews.author: saintman

customer_reviews.title: Good for entry level/ casual athlete
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and very easy to use. My complaints are the battery doesn't last quite long enough. When I go for a ride that's 4+ hours or a day of racing it struggles to last. Also not very durable, I've broken 4 in about a year, Garmin is quick to takes care of these issues, but it's still a hassle having to send it back all the time. Maybe not the best choice if you ride mountain bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Burgie

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty good. Timing is accurate. I'm still learning the features. My only major disappointment is the connect store does not have a program for aerobics that I have found. Also haven't found a good weight lifting program to use for tracking strength and stamina.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Native

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I love Garmin! Upgraded from Vivofit 2, then 3 and now Vivoactive because of my failing eyesight :(. This one has bigger screen. Love the battery life - a charge lasts me over 2 weeks. I take it to shower with me, in the pool, and I don't take it off to wash the dishes either.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Good, hope it gets better with firmware updates
customer_reviews.text: I am generally pleased with the Vivoactive. It is a comfortable to wear and slim everyday watch. The display is easy enough to read. Some pros: - quick satellite acquisition for GPS - adding different apps and watch faces - long batter duration - find my phone Some cons: - only vibrates, no beep or chirp - steps no visible on home screen without customizing watch face - GPS signal easily drops in areas with slight/moderate tree cover
customer_reviews.author: Greg Friese

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable - Runners Fall!
customer_reviews.text: I was really enjoying my watch. The interface is user-friendly and was intuitive to use. Most people are concerned about having to download the Connect app, but it was a quick download and very easy to use. My main challenge with the watch is its durability. I use it for road-running primarily. We runners know how often we trip and fall. I had my first fall today with the Garmin Vivoactive. The screen cracked instantly and the watch is completely non-functional at the moment. I am wary of re-purchasing the Vivoactive and perhaps any other Garmin at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Addicted to this tracker
customer_reviews.text: Love the features. Motivates me to move. It sometimes tells me to move when I'm already moving??? But works well otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Myra L Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Screen becomes more visible in the sunlight. Works great for my needs. I do about 4 triathlons a year. The swim lap counter could be off or maybe I'm just counting wrong.....we'll never know. GPS is great, I can see my runs mapped on my phone. Haven't tested it on the bike yet, but will do today. And submit revision of feedback when that happens
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: fastest gps pickup i've seen in garmin product, that ...
customer_reviews.text: changing to 5. fastest gps pickup i've seen in garmin product, that i've owned. screen is dark. sometimes rubs on long sleeves and changes sceens, but works well for standard run tracking and strava sync. Love that i can control my phone's music with the watch, while running with gps, next song, volume, pause, while phone is transmitting to Bluetooth speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T

customer_reviews.title: Mr Reliable - love this watch
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch a couple of years ago to train for my marathon, but it has been EXTREMELY useful. Between swimming, the pedometer, accurate GPS, biking, and golf this watch has paid for itself and is crazy durable. They redid the app recently too. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Worst warranty ever. Don't buy if you're active whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: Had it 3 months and their cheap screen broke even with a glass screen protector. Contacted Garmin for a replacement to find out they have no warranty for damage. It's $100 to exchange for a new working watch. Absolute joke of a warranty. Spend the extra money and go with a better company's product.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Makes having a watch routine again.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it lasts two or three weeks between needing to charge it, the tracking and phone connection with notifications and music is just great. I had gotten away from using a watch with the advent of the smart phone, this watch made using a watch part of my routine again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase so far. GPS is what you'd expect from Garmin, and the look of the watch is awesome IMO. I read elsewhere that you can't dismiss the texts and notifications from the watchface, but in fact you can. Con: the watchface is very dim at a glance when it's dark. I think this is how the battery lasts so long so i don't mind hitting the backlight when needed.
customer_reviews.author: james kenneth wegner

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this watch
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this watch. The walking app pauses and restarts constantly, giving false steps, times and distance. The swim app adds meters that were not performed. I would not recommend this watch. I contacted Garmin and they were of no help. They gave unnecessary scenarios that did not apply.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Jo Kasman

customer_reviews.title: I like the notifications
customer_reviews.text: I use it for swimming, and have not had any problems with it yet. It does everything I want it to do, and a few extra things. I like the notifications. I don't like that it tells me when I have been sitting at my desk for too long, only because it is a reminder that I am trapped in a cube farm. If you want a water proof fitness tracker that has added features of a smart watch, this is a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mórlóg

customer_reviews.title: Great No Frills Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: It's been like ten days since I got this and I haven't even charged it once. Battery life is a beast! All great features, tons of watch faces, even custom ones. Face can get a little dark at times and the resolution may not be the best compared to other smart watches. But you can't beat the price for a smart watch. Easily stores all my workouts with ease and it tells the time and notifies me. Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Diego Cancino

customer_reviews.title: I like to keep track of how many laps I swim
customer_reviews.text: I like to keep track of how many laps I swim. Thats hard to do when the garmin loses a lap of a 25 yard pool and then gains laps at times. I swam 100 yards lat nite and it showed 125 yards then it lost 50 yards then it gained 75 yards on and on. if i cant trust it to keep track of a 25 yard pool how can it even be close about the stats that it gives you no not happy I gave it half a doz chances no no no
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: I like it but it doesn't count steps in my office.... maybe a hint that I should go for a run instead update. not even 3 month old and it marked me running over 200 miles instead of the 5 miles I ran.
customer_reviews.author: Boots

product_meta.title: Garmin vívoactive Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:Without Heart Rate Monitor

GPS SMARTWATCH FOR THE ACTIVE LIFESTYLE
 * Ultra-thin GPS smartwatch with a sunlight-readable, high-resolution color touchscreen
 * Built-in sports apps, including GPS-enabled running, biking and golfing plus swimming and activity tracking, let you view your stats even when away from your phone
 * Pairs with your smartphone to gently vibrate and display alerts for incoming calls, texts, emails and calendar items plus notifications from social media and other mobile apps
 * Customize with free watch face designs, widgets and apps from our Connect IQ store
 * Battery charge lasts through all your activities with up to 3 weeks5 in watch/activity tracking mode or up to 10 hours using GPS

From the company that has been developing robust, dedicated wearable technology to improve training metrics for athletes for more than a decade comes the GPS smartwatch for the active lifestyle. Introducing vívoactive — the ultra-thin, lightweight smartwatch with built-in Garmin sports apps that you can wear every day to help you keep a healthy balance between work and life.

FROM WORK TO WORKOUT
Play harder, work smarter, live better with vívoactive. Built-in sports apps keep you active while smart notifications allow you to stay in contact with pressing work matters — all so you can keep your life in balance. The high-resolution, color touchscreen stays readable in direct sunlight, so you can view your stats when you step out of the office for a run. The ultra-thin profile — 8 mm — is comfortable to wear all day and can easily transition from office to golf course. You won’t have to worry about vívoactive keeping up with your active days. The rechargeable battery lasts through all your activities with up to 3 weeks5 in watch/activity-tracking mode or up to 10 hours using GPS.

BUILT-IN SPORTS APPS
vívoactive features built-in sports apps that track your stats — even when away from your phone. Simply tap to choose among GPS-enabled running, golfing and cycling apps plus swimming and activity tracking.



HIT THE GROUND RUNNING
Whether you’re training for a 5K or just for life in general, the running app uses GPS to capture essential running data such as distance and pace. A built-in accelerometer and wrist-based speed and cadence trackers eliminate the need for a separate foot pod when running on an indoor track or treadmill and also when GPS is unavailable. You can set up vibration alerts for heart rate¹, pace and run/walk intervals. Other training features include Auto Lap and Auto Pause. Automatic sync with Garmin Connect Mobile gives you a post-run summary, including calories burned and if you scored any personal records, such as your fastest or longest run to date.



GET IN GEAR


The GPS-enabled cycling app measures time, distance, speed and calories. Compatible with sensors² such as speed, cadence and heart rate monitors to measure your progress on training rides as well as daily commutes.

TEE OFF


Pair with your smartphone³ to download course maps from our golf course database — with more than 38,000 courses worldwide — to play favorite and new courses. The golfing app keeps maps updated and tallies hole number and par. GPS measures layup and dogleg distances, as well as distances to the front, middle and back of the green, to improve usability over the entire hole. Individual stroke play scorecard lets you see if you’re under or over par. Measure shot distance at the press of a button. Round timer counts up time on the course, while the built-in accelerometer tracks your steps.

DIVE IN
Auto Length accelerometer-based technology automatically gauges total and interval distance; laps; calories burned; session average, interval and length pace; and stroke count, including number of strokes per length and interval and session averages. Let the swimming app calculate your efficiency with swolf, which adds the time and the number of strokes it takes to swim a pool length. View your time and interval distance at a glance. Interval Count lets you seamlessly pause and then resume your workout.

The thin profile cuts through the water, and its 5 ATM water rating means you can swim, sweat and shower with it on, worry-free.



STEP IT UP
vívoactive follows your progress even when you’re not engaged in a specific activity. The activity tracking app tracks your steps to learn your current activity level, then assigns an attainable daily step count goal. As you meet your milestones, the device will adjust your goal for the next day. The red move bar appears on the display after 1 hour of inactivity and builds when you’ve been sitting too long. Just walk for a couple of minutes to reset the move bar. Set the sleep mode when you go to bed and vívoactive will monitor your rest. It also tracks your calories burned.



STAY CONNECTED
vívoactive gently vibrates to alert you to all the same notifications you receive on your compatible Bluetooth-enabled device4. Receive caller ID and missed call information for incoming calls. Text messages include sender information and message. Email messages come with sender and subject. vívoactive also displays notifications from Facebook, Twitter and other social media platforms, as well as other mobile apps, including weather alerts and temperature. Simply touch and swipe the screen to read more, or clear the screen with the press of a button.


ADVANCED SMARTWATCH FEATURES
vívoactive lets you control the tunes on your music player, locate your phone and let your friends and family track your activities in real time with Live Track. You can also remotely control your VIRB Elite action camera.

CUSTOM APPS AND WATCH FACES
Personalize vívoactive with free downloads from our Connect IQ store. You can customize your watch face, add data fields and get apps and widgets that provide information at a glance.

 

CHALLENGE YOURSELF
Stay up to date on your progress for each of the built-in activities with automatic syncs with Garmin Connect Mobile. You can earn virtual badges for extra motivation, join online challenges and connect, compete and compare with friends and family around the world. View your history and stats right on the smartwatch.

SHOW YOUR TRUE COLORS
vívoactive comes in basic black or bright white to coordinate with your philosophy of style. Swap out additional bands to show your true colors, or dress it up with a leather option in black or white.

In the Box

 * vívoactive
 * Charging/data clip
 * Manual

¹Heart rate monitor available with some versions; sold separately with others
²Sold separately
³Syncs when within 30 feet of your compatible smartphone
4Compatible with iPhone 4S or later and select Bluetooth Smart-capable Android™ devices. See compatible list at http://support.garmin.com/support/searchSupport/case.faces?caseId={bbfc9660-8f77-11e3-d5f4-000000000000}. iPhone is a trademark of Apple Inc. Android is a trademark of Google Inc.
5Battery life varies based on usage and smartphone model
feature_bullets: Built-in sports apps, including GPS-enabled running, biking and golfing plus swimming and activity tracking¹, let you view your stats even when away from your phone(Check User Manual in Product Information before use)
Refer to page 10 in the User Manual for troubleshooting steps.
Ultra-thin, high-resolution, sunlight-readable, color touchscreen display

Built-in sports apps, including GPS-enabled running, biking and golfing plus swimming and activity tracking, let you view your stats even when away from your phone(Check User Manual in Product Information before use)
Battery charge lasts through all your activities with up to 3 weeks in watch/activity tracking mode or up to 10 hours using GPS
Customize with free watch face designs, widgets and apps from Connect IQ store
Display Size: 28.6 x 20.7 mm (W x H)
